comments:
On a previous run I also saw a few errors towards the start with the following:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Class 'InfoType' does not have a feature
named 'any'
       at

       at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil.getBoolean(SDOUtil.java:1470)
       at
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.impl.DynamicEStoreEDataObjectImpl.getBoolean(DynamicEStoreEDataObjectImpl.java:270)
       at
com.ibm.websphere.samples.wsbench.ifxbank.WSBenchPortRouter.handle(Unknown Source)
        ..............

This would be when there is the greatest chance of high concurrency in the
mediation (might help?)

    <Note note>
This looks like a thread safety issue within SDO. The
datagraphs themselves will be completely separate
instances. (In other words, there are two (or more)
SDO datagraphs being processed on separate threads).

It looks like the code that handles compound objects
and/or lists is not thread safe across different
SDO instances.

---------------------------------
Comments from Ed ...

Looking at how our pool of Accessors is used it's clear now that we should not
recycle the Accessor until after we've used it for the last time.  For example,
this before-fixes version looks bad:

     public Object getAndRecyle()
     {
       pool.recycle(this);
       return get();
      }
     
And this after-fixes version should be better:

     public Object getAndRecyle()
     {
       Object result = get();
       pool.recycle(this);
       return result;
      }
     
Note that the get() and the recycle() methods on the pool are synchronized, so
the pool itself is definitely thread safe.
The fix has been committed to CVS.
